document.docAuthor: Ornosa, Concepción, Torres, Félix & Rúa, Pilar De La
document.masterDocTitle: Updated list of bumblebees (Hymenoptera: Apidae) from the Spanish Pyrenees with notes on their decline and conservation status

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Updated list of bumblebees (Hymenoptera: Apidae) from the Spanish Pyrenees with notes on their decline and conservation status

subSubSection.paragraph: It has a wider distribution than the nominate subspecies, from the Pyrenees along the Cantabrian Range, to Picos de Europa and Sierra de los Ancares, entering into further south at higher elevations in the Guadalajara, La Rioja , Soria, Segovia and Teruel provinces, from 150 (in the north) to 2200 m ( Ornosa & Ortiz-Sanchez, 2004 ).

At present it has been collected in the Pyrenees between
1430 and 2300
m ( Fig. 7 ), in forest, upper forest grasslands and bogs and in mixed forests with beech and pine wood of
Pinus uncinata
and
Pinus sylvestris
with patches of subalpine scrub of
Juniperus communis nana Willd.
,
Rhododendron ferrugineum
and
Calluna vulgaris
(L.) Hull, foraging on
Acinos alpinum
(L.),
Centaurea scabiosa
L.,
Cirsium acaule
(L.) Scop.,
Cirsium monspessulanum
(L.) Hill,
Cynoglossum officinale
L.,
Echium vulgare L.
,
Eryngium bourgatii Gouan.
,
Eriophorum angustifolium Honck.
,
Gentiana lutea
L.,
Jurinea humilis (Desf.)
DC.,
Lotus corniculatus
L.,
Origanum vulgare
L.,
Phlomis lychnitis
L.,
Ranunculus acris
L.,
Rhododendron ferrugineum
L.,
Silene acaulis
(L.) Jacq.,
Trifolium pratense L.
,
Trifolium repens L.
and
Vicia cracca L.
